intro: Archibaccharis caloneura, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of Brazil. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dune ecosystems. Its floral structure includes five petals and stamens, typical of the Malvaceae family. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
